derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from obsolete French cramoisin or Old Spanish cremesin, based on Arabic kirmizī, from kirmiz (see kermes). Compare with carmine

encyclopedia.content: 基本资料 曾用名：Little Red、Tommy Mercer、Crimson 性别：男 绰号：冷血人 本名：Tommy Mercer 现居地：美国俄亥俄州克里夫兰市 首次登台：2007年 教练：Jeff Daniels、Harley Race 现状：TNA新秀选手，Amazing Red的弟弟。 终结技：Mercy Kill曾获荣誉 NWA美国中部地区电视冠军x1次

entry.def: Something that is crimson is deep red in colour.

example.ex: ...the lurid, crimson glow of the blast furnaces.
example.tran: 鼓风炉里耀眼、通红的火光

entry.def: If a person goes crimson, their face becomes red because they are angry or embarrassed.

example.ex: I used to refuse invitations to parties because I knew I'd go crimson every time someone talked to me.
example.tran: 我过去总是拒绝聚会邀请，因为我知道每当有人和我说话，我就会脸红。

means.word_mean: 1. turn red, as if in embarrassment or shame;

sentences.sentence: "The girl blushed when a young man whistled as she walked by"

means.word_mean: 1. having any of numerous bright or strong colors reminiscent of the color of blood or cherries or tomatoes or rubies

sentences.sentence: "writes of crimson deeds and barbaric days"- Andrea Parke
"fann'd by Conquest's crimson wing"- Thomas Gray

means.word_mean: 3. (especially of the face) reddened or suffused with or as if with blood from emotion or exertion;

Sentence.sentence: A recent article in The Harvard Crimson noted the shocking growth of Harvard's public relations arm in the last five years and it questioned whether a focus on risk management and avoiding controversy was really the best outward-looking face of this great institution.
